void CKCU_ClearIntFlag ( u32  CKCU_INT)

Clear the CKCU interrupt flag.

Parameters:
CKCU_INT,:specify the CKCU interrupt flag to clear. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
  • CKCU_INT_CKS : HSE clock failure interrupt flag (NMI)
Return values:
None

Definition at line 177 of file ht32f5xxxx_ckcu.c.

FlagStatus CKCU_GetClockReadyStatus ( u32  CKCU_FLAG)

Check whether the specific clock ready flag is set or not.

Parameters:
CKCU_FLAG,:specify the clock ready flag. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • CKCU_FLAG_USBPLLRDY : USB PLL ready flag
  • CKCU_FLAG_PLLRDY : PLL ready flag
  • CKCU_FLAG_HSERDY : HSE ready flag
  • CKCU_FLAG_HSIRDY : HSI ready flag
  • CKCU_FLAG_LSERDY : LSE ready flag
  • CKCU_FLAG_LSIRDY : LSI ready flag
Return values:
SETor RESET

Parameters:
CKCU_Clk,:pointer to CKCU_ClocksTypeDef structure to get the clocks frequency.
Return values:
None

Definition at line 543 of file ht32f5xxxx_ckcu.c.

FlagStatus CKCU_GetIntStatus ( u32  CKCU_INT)

Check whether the specific CKCU interrupt has occurred or not.

Parameters:
CKCU_INT,:specify the CKCU interrupt source. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
  • CKCU_INT_CKS: HSE clock failure interrupt flag (NMI)
Return values:
SETor RESET

Definition at line 764 of file ht32f5xxxx_ckcu.c.

u32 CKCU_GetPeripFrequency ( CKCU_PeripPrescaler_TypeDef  Perip)

Return the operating frequency of the specific APB peripheral.

Parameters:
Perip,:specify the APB peripheral. This parameter can be:
  • CKCU_PCLK_I2C0, CKCU_PCLK_I2C1, CKCU_PCLK_I2C2, CKCU_PCLK_SPI0, CKCU_PCLK_SPI1, CKCU_PCLK_CAN0, CKCU_PCLK_BFTM0, CKCU_PCLK_BFTM1, CKCU_PCLK_MCTM0, CKCU_PCLK_GPTM0, CKCU_PCLK_GPTM1, CKCU_PCLK_USART0, CKCU_PCLK_USART1, CKCU_PCLK_UART0, CKCU_PCLK_UART1, CKCU_PCLK_UART2, CKCU_PCLK_UART3 CKCU_PCLK_AFIO, CKCU_PCLK_EXTI, CKCU_PCLK_ADC0, CKCU_PCLK_ADC1, CKCU_PCLK_CMP, CKCU_PCLK_OPA CKCU_PCLK_WDTR, CKCU_PCLK_BKPR, CKCU_PCLK_SCI0, CKCU_PCLK_SCI1, CKCU_PCLK_I2S, CKCU_PCLK_PWM0, CKCU_PCLK_PWM1 CKCU_PCLK_AFE, CKCU_PCLK_DAC0, CKCU_PCLK_DAC1, CKCU_PCLK_MIDI CKCU_PCLK_LEDC, CKCU_PCLK_TKEY
Return values:
Frequencyin Hz

PLLFrequency

Definition at line 600 of file ht32f5xxxx_ckcu.c.

u32 CKCU_GetSysClockSource ( void  )

Return the source clock which is used as system clock.

Return values:
Thesource clock used as system clock. 0x01: PLL is selected as system clock 0x02: HSE is selected as system clock 0x03: HSI is selected as system clock 0x06: LSE is selected as system clock 0x07: LSI is selected as system clock

Definition at line 447 of file ht32f5xxxx_ckcu.c.

void CKCU_HSECmd ( ControlStatus  Cmd)

Enable or Disable the external high speed oscillator (HSE).

Note:
HSE can not be stopped if it is used by system clock or PLL.
Parameters:
Cmd,:This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
Return values:
None

Definition at line 227 of file ht32f5xxxx_ckcu.c.

void CKCU_HSIAutoTrimClkConfig ( CKCU_ATC_TypeDef  CLKSRC)

Configure the reference clock of HSI auto-trim function.

Parameters:
CLKSRC,:specify the clock source. This parameter can be:
  • CKCU_ATC_LSE: LSE is selected as reference clock
  • CKCU_ATC_USB: USB is selected as reference clock
  • CKCU_ATC_CKIN: External pin (CKIN) is selected as reference clock
Return values:
None

Parameters:
Cmd,:This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
Return values:

ControlStatus  Cmd 
)

Enable or Disable the specific CKCU interrupts.

Parameters:
CKCU_INT,:specify the CKCU interrupt source which is enabled or disabled. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
  • CKCU_INT_CKSIE : HSE clock failure interrupt (NMI)
Cmd,:This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
Return values:

Definition at line 802 of file ht32f5xxxx_ckcu.c.

bool CKCU_IS_HSE_USED ( CKCU_HSEST_TypeDef  Target)

Check HSE clock used by the specific target source or not.

Parameters:
Target,:specify the target clock. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • CKCU_HSEST_SYSCK : Is HSE used by system clock
  • CKCU_HSEST_PLL : Is HSE used by PLL
Return values:
TRUEor FALSE

Definition at line 900 of file ht32f5xxxx_ckcu.c.

bool CKCU_IS_HSI_USED ( CKCU_HSIST_TypeDef  Target)

Check HSI clock used by the specific target source or not.

Parameters:
Target,:specify the target clock. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • CKCU_HSIST_SYSCK : Is HSI used by system clock
  • CKCU_HSIST_PLL : Is HSI used by PLL
  • CKCU_HSIST_CKM : Is HSI used by clock monitor
Return values:
TRUEor FALSE

Definition at line 880 of file ht32f5xxxx_ckcu.c.

bool CKCU_IS_PLL_USED ( CKCU_PLLST_TypeDef  Target)

Check if PLL clock used by the specific target source or not.

Parameters:
Target,:specify the target clock. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • CKCU_PLLST_SYSCK : Is PLL used by system clock
  • CKCU_PLLST_USB : Is PLL used by USB
  • CKCU_PLLST_REFCK : Is PLL used by CK_REF
Return values:
TRUEor FALSE

void CKCU_MCUDBGConfig ( u32  CKCU_DBGx,
ControlStatus  Cmd 
)

Enable or Disable the specific debug function.

Parameters:
CKCU_DBGx,:specify the debug functions to be enabled or disabled. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
  • CKCU_DBG_SLEEP, CKCU_DBG_DEEPSLEEP1, CKCU_DBG_DEEPSLEEP2, CKCU_DBG_POWERDOWN, CKCU_DBG_MCTM0_HALT, CKCU_DBG_GPTM0_HALT, CKCU_DBG_GPTM1_HALT, CKCU_DBG_SCTM0_HALT, CKCU_DBG_SCTM1_HALT, CKCU_DBG_SCTM2_HALT, CKCU_DBG_SCTM3_HALT, CKCU_DBG_BFTM0_HALT, CKCU_DBG_BFTM1_HALT, CKCU_DBG_USART0_HALT, CKCU_DBG_USART1_HALT, CKCU_DBG_UART0_HALT, CKCU_DBG_UART1_HALT, CKCU_DBG_UART2_HALT, CKCU_DBG_UART3_HALT, CKCU_DBG_SPI0_HALT, CKCU_DBG_SPI1_HALT, CKCU_DBG_QSPI_HALT, CKCU_DBG_I2C0_HALT, CKCU_DBG_I2C1_HALT, CKCU_DBG_I2C2_HALT, CKCU_DBG_CAN0_HALT CKCU_DBG_SCI0_HALT, CKCU_DBG_SCI1_HALT, CKCU_DBG_WDT_HALT, CKCU_DBG_PWM0_HALT, CKCU_DBG_PWM1_HALT, CKCU_DBG_PWM2_HALT,
Cmd,:This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
Return values:
None

Definition at line 739 of file ht32f5xxxx_ckcu.c.

void CKCU_SetADCnPrescaler ( CKCU_ADCPRE_ADCn_TypeDef  CKCU_ADCPRE_ADCn,
CKCU_ADCPRE_TypeDef  CKCU_ADCPRE_DIVn 
)

Configure the CK_ADCn prescaler.

Parameters:
CKCU_ADCPRE_ADCn,:specify the ADCn.
CKCU_ADCPRE_DIVn,:specify the prescaler value. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • CKCU_ADCPRE_DIV1 : CK_ADC = HCLK / 1
  • CKCU_ADCPRE_DIV2 : CK_ADC = HCLK / 2
  • CKCU_ADCPRE_DIV3 : CK_ADC = HCLK / 3
  • CKCU_ADCPRE_DIV4 : CK_ADC = HCLK / 4
  • CKCU_ADCPRE_DIV8 : CK_ADC = HCLK / 8
  • CKCU_ADCPRE_DIV16 : CK_ADC = HCLK / 16
  • CKCU_ADCPRE_DIV32 : CK_ADC = HCLK / 32
  • CKCU_ADCPRE_DIV64 : CK_ADC = HCLK / 64
Return values:
None

Definition at line 496 of file ht32f5xxxx_ckcu.c.

void CKCU_SetCKREFPrescaler ( CKCU_CKREFPRE_TypeDef  CKREFPRE)

Configure the CK_REF prescaler.

Parameters:
CKREFPRE,:specify the value of divider. This parameter can be: CKCU_CKREFPRE_DIV2 to CKCU_CKREFPRE_DIV64 (CK_REF = CK_PLL / (2 * (N + 1)), N = 0 ~ 31)
Return values:
None

Definition at line 475 of file ht32f5xxxx_ckcu.c.

void CKCU_SetHCLKPrescaler ( CKCU_SYSCLKDIV_TypeDef  HCLKPRE)

Configure the CK_AHB prescaler.

Parameters:
HCLKPRE,:specify the value of divider. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • CKCU_SYSCLK_DIV1 : HCLK = CK_SYS
  • CKCU_SYSCLK_DIV2 : HCLK = CK_SYS / 2
  • CKCU_SYSCLK_DIV4 : HCLK = CK_SYS / 4
  • CKCU_SYSCLK_DIV8 : HCLK = CK_SYS / 8
  • CKCU_SYSCLK_DIV16 : HCLK = CK_SYS / 16
  • CKCU_SYSCLK_DIV32 : HCLK = CK_SYS / 32
Return values:
None

Definition at line 464 of file ht32f5xxxx_ckcu.c.

void CKCU_SetPeripPrescaler ( CKCU_PeripPrescaler_TypeDef  Perip,
CKCU_APBCLKPRE_TypeDef  PCLKPrescaler 
)

Configure the APB peripheral prescaler.

Parameters:
Perip,:specify the APB peripheral. This parameter can be:
  • CKCU_PCLK_I2C0, CKCU_PCLK_I2C1, CKCU_PCLK_I2C2, CKCU_PCLK_SPI0, CKCU_PCLK_SPI1, CKCU_PCLK_CAN0, CKCU_PCLK_BFTM0, CKCU_PCLK_BFTM1, CKCU_PCLK_MCTM0, CKCU_PCLK_GPTM0, CKCU_PCLK_GPTM1, CKCU_PCLK_USART0, CKCU_PCLK_USART1, CKCU_PCLK_UART0, CKCU_PCLK_UART1, CKCU_PCLK_UART2, CKCU_PCLK_UART3 CKCU_PCLK_AFIO, CKCU_PCLK_EXTI, CKCU_PCLK_ADC, CKCU_PCLK_CMP, CKCU_PCLK_OPA CKCU_PCLK_WDTR, CKCU_PCLK_BKPR, CKCU_PCLK_SCI0, CKCU_PCLK_SCI1, CKCU_PCLK_I2S, CKCU_PCLK_SCTM0, CKCU_PCLK_SCTM1, CKCU_PCLK_SCTM2, CKCU_PCLK_SCTM3 CKCU_PCLK_PWM0, CKCU_PCLK_PWM1 CKCU_PCLK_AFE, CKCU_PCLK_DAC0, CKCU_PCLK_DAC1, CKCU_PCLK_MIDI CKCU_PCLK_LEDC, CKCU_PCLK_TKEY
PCLKPrescaler,:specify the value of prescaler. This parameter can be:
  • CKCU_APBCLKPRE_DIV1: specific peripheral clock = PCLK / 1 (inapplicable to BKPRCLK)
  • CKCU_APBCLKPRE_DIV2: specific peripheral clock = PCLK / 2 (inapplicable to BKPRCLK)
  • CKCU_APBCLKPRE_DIV4: specific peripheral clock = PCLK / 4
  • CKCU_APBCLKPRE_DIV8: specific peripheral clock = PCLK / 8
  • CKCU_APBCLKPRE_DIV16: specific peripheral clock = PCLK / 16 (BKPRCLK only)
  • CKCU_APBCLKPRE_DIV32: specific peripheral clock = PCLK / 32 (BKPRCLK only)
Return values:
None

Definition at line 667 of file ht32f5xxxx_ckcu.c.

void CKCU_SleepClockConfig ( u32  CKCU_CLK,
ControlStatus  Cmd 
)

Enable or Disable the AHB peripheral clock during SLEEP mode.

Parameters:
CKCU_CLK,:specify the clock which is enabled or disabled. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
  • CKCU_AHBEN_SLEEP_FMC, CKCU_AHBEN_SLEEP_SRAM, CKCU_AHBEN_SLEEP_BM, CKCU_AHBEN_SLEEP_APB0,
Cmd,:This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
Return values:
None

Definition at line 832 of file ht32f5xxxx_ckcu.c.

ErrStatus CKCU_SysClockConfig ( CKCU_SW_TypeDef  CLKSRC)

Configure the CK_SYS source.

Parameters:
CLKSRC,:specify the system clock source. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • CKCU_SW_PLL : PLL is selected as CK_SYS
  • CKCU_SW_HSE : HSE is selected as CK_SYS
  • CKCU_SW_HSI : HSI is selected as CK_SYS
  • CKCU_SW_LSE : LSE is selected as CK_SYS
  • CKCU_SW_LSI : LSI is selected as CK_SYS
Return values:
None

Definition at line 420 of file ht32f5xxxx_ckcu.c.

ErrStatus CKCU_WaitHSEReady ( void  )

Wait for HSE is ready to be used.

Return values:
SUCCESSor ERROR
